data.title: Family of Raymond Arthur Wilkinson and Ida Kathleen Lock
data.text:
Name:

Raymond Arthur Wilkinson1,3,4,5,6

Sex:

Male

Father:

Edward Henry Wilkinson (1861-1934)

Mother:

Cassandra Elizabeth Palmer (1861-1940)

Executive Summary:

was a plumber's apprentice in 1911, a medic in the Army during WW1, in the RAMC service number K2/RAMC/28687, a plumber, working for the Suffolk Waterworks, becoming a plumber and hot water fitter by 1920 and retired by 1972

Occupation:

WWI army medic, plumber / hot water fitter then a waterworks engineer5,7,8,9,10,11

Birth:

25 Oct 1895

23 Hordle Street, Dovercourt, Essex, England3,4,6,10,11,12,13

son of Edward Henri Wilkinson (mariner railway service) and Cassandra Elizabeth Wilkinson formally Palmer

Census:

31 Mar 1901 (age 5)

23 Hordle Street, Dovercourt, Essex, England12

son living with his mother Cassandra and brothers Oliver, Bertie, Herman and Baden, and sisters Ivy and Dorothy. Born in Dovercourt Essex

Census:

2 Apr 1911 (age 15)

Egerton, High Street, Dovercourt, Essex, England10

an umarried son employed as a plumber apprentice for an iron monger and living in six rooms with his parents Edward and Cassandra, and brothers Herman, Baden and Ronald. Born in Dovercourt Essex

Census:

29 Sep 1939 (age 43)

Tower House, Tuddenham Lane, Rushmere St. Andrew, Suffolk, England11

married waterworks engineer born on 25th October 1895 and living with his wife and presumably two children as their records are closed

Address:

1970 (age 74-75)

97 Orwell Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England7

Death:

20 Mar 1972 (age 76)

97 Orwell Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England5,6,7,14

a plumber & hot water fitter (retired) who died of carcinoma of stomach and coronary artery disease. His widow Ida Kathleen Wilkinson was present at his death

Cremation:

24 Mar 1972

Ipswich Crematorium, Belvedere Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England7

Name:

Ida Kathleen Lock1,3,7

Sex:

Female

Father:

-

Father:

-

Occupation:

commercial clerk9

Birth:

21 Aug 1897

Derby Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England1,3,14,15,16,17,18

daughter of James Lock (engine fitter (foundry)) and Louisa Jane Lock formally Sporle

Census:

31 Mar 1901 (age 3)

59 Derby Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England16

a daughter living with her parents and three siblings. Born in Ipswich Suffolk

Census:

2 Apr 1911 (age 13)

59 Derby Road, Ipswich, Suffolk, England17

a daughter attending school and living with her parents and three siblings. Born in Ipswich Suffolk

Census:

29 Sep 1939 (age 42)

Tower House, Tuddenham Lane, Rushmere St. Andrew, Suffolk, England11

married housewife born on 21st August 1897 and living with her husband and presumably two children as their records are closed

Death:

13 Dec 1988 (age 91)

East Runton, Norfolk, England7,14,18

Name:

Derek Raymond Wilkinson7,26

Sex:

Male

Name Suffix:

BEM

Spouse (1):

Eveline L Merry (1919-1970)

Spouse (2):

Linda Merle Sayer (1944-2017)

Occupation:

sailor in the Royal Navy specialising in radio telephony8,14,27

Royal Navy until 20th Nov. 1967 Last rank Chief Petty Officer, Chief Radio Supervisor?

Birth:

21 Nov 1922

Ipswich, Suffolk, England14,28,29,30

Military Beginning:

21 Nov 1938 (age 16)8,14,25

joining the Royal Navy at HMS Ganges Shotley Suffolk

Census absence:

29 Sep 1939 (age 16)

due to military service

Medals:

195631

Royal Navy Long Service and Good Conduct Medals

Medals:

1958

Singapore7

received his BEM for his work while in charge of a secret radio operation during the period September 1957 to May 1958

Military Ending:

20 Nov 1967 (age 44)8,14,21

last rank Chief Petty Officer, Chief Radio Supervisor?

Death:

11 Apr 1977 (age 54)

Chichester, West Sussex, England14,30

Cremation:

21 Apr 1977

Chichester Crematorium, Westhampnett Road, Chichester, West Sussex, England7,8,14

Ashes scattered:

1 Jun 1977

The Solent, Hampshire, England7,8,14

between Portsmouth and the Isle of Wight
